Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient is stressed about the custody situation regarding her son, feeling overwhelmed by family pressures and opinions.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient experiences fluctuations in mood, often feeling down when thinking about her son. She has tried distraction techniques but finds them sometimes ineffective.
Mental Health Observations: The patient feels calmer after practicing a grounding exercise and acknowledges the importance of integrating mindfulness techniques into her routine.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to journal more positively and practice grounding exercises to manage anxiety.
Next Steps: The patient aims to focus on writing positively in her journal and practicing grounding techniques before the next session.
